meanings.definition: To exchange places or switch positions.
meanings.sent1: The students were interchanging their seats in the classroom.
meanings.sent2: The siblings were interchanging their toys to play with different ones.
meanings.sent3: The birds were interchanging their perches on the tree, causing a funny sight.
meanings.sent4: The dancers were interchanging partners gracefully during the performance.
meanings.sent5: The gears in the machine were interchanging smoothly, ensuring efficient operation.

meanings.definition: To alternate or switch back and forth.
meanings.sent1: The traffic lights were interchanging between red and green.
meanings.sent2: The children were interchanging between playing outside and watching TV.
meanings.sent3: The weather was interchanging between sunny and rainy unpredictably.
meanings.sent4: The emotions on her face were interchanging rapidly, showing conflicting feelings.
meanings.sent5: The pendulum was interchanging its movement from left to right continuously.

meanings.definition: The act of swapping or trading.
meanings.sent1: The interchanging of gifts during the holiday season brought joy to everyone.
meanings.sent2: The interchanging of ideas between team members led to a creative solution.
meanings.sent3: The interchanging of roles in the play made the audience laugh at the mix-up.
meanings.sent4: The interchanging of currency at the airport was quick and convenient.
meanings.sent5: The interchanging of seats at the event allowed guests to meet new people easily.
